TopicTitle: An idea for writers and stressers alike.

Articles.Content:
Hi.

So I need to write a book, but a computer in bed would likely get me slammed. Also, sometimes I trudge to sleep fuming, and just wanna cuss into my pillow. However, one word slips by the muffle, and you got yourself a grounding. So what to do? What if we took the voice-cancelling technology of a stenograph, and an optional microphone function? You get being able to speak all you want without a word slipping by! I want one - now!
Couldn\'t you just write in a normal room at a normal time?

Couldn\'t you just write in a normal room at a normal time?

Yes, but if you want to get ideas from a public place or a library, you can\'t talk.
Bleh, I don\'t think I\'d find this useful. Half the time, I\'m the one telling my parents to stop swearing XD

Yes, but if you want to get ideas from a public place or a library, you can\'t talk.

You could just write in silence?
